revised_title: Ionization Drift and Electric Fields in the Ionosphere
tldr: The author investigates the movement of ionization in the ionosphere under the influence of winds and electric fields. They find that the motion of ionization is electrodynamically stable but hydrodynamically unstable, leading to the accumulation of ionization on one side of a cylinder and depletion on the other. This phenomenon is suggested to be the origin of sporadic E ionization and may play a significant role in the production of long-lasting meteor trails detected by radio methods.
